a 24 volt battery in a 12 volt car isn't
that complicated but you have two
problems one is it puts a lot of wear
and tear on the motors especially when
you're accelerating because the pedal is
only an on and off switch it's not like
the gas pedal on a car the other problem
is that it'll give the kids Whiplash and
it'll pop wheelies and stuff because all
of a sudden you hit that pedal and
instantly you get 24 volts of power so
all these complicated Electronics solve
that problem first off this knob puts a
delay on the acceleration so there's a
one second delay where it takes one
second to go from zero to full speed or
you can go five seconds from zero to
full speed so it accelerates gradually
the other thing it does is it has like a
dimmer switch here which can govern the
maximum voltage use you can either use
all 24 volts or you can go at fifty
percent use 12 volts or 25 percent and
only use six volts so depending on the
